Package view_control

Class CustomerWindowController

java.lang.Object
view_control.CustomerWindowController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class CustomerWindowController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Version:
1.0 Contains methods for the Customer Window GUI.
Author:
Brayden McArthur

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    CustomerWindowController()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addButtonClicked()
    Changes the scene to a new window where a user can enter data to create a new customer and save it to the database.
    void backButtonClicked()
    The back button changes the scene back to the main window
    void deleteButtonClicked()
    Deletes the selected Customer and displays an Alert Box with a confirmation that the Customer was deleted successfully.
    Customer getSelectedCustomer()
    Gets the selected Customer object from the customerTable.
    void initialize​(java.net.URL url, java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
    Initializes the tableview when the scene is changed to this window.
    void modifyButtonClicked()
    Changes the scene to a new window where a user can modify existing Customer data and save it to the database.

  • Constructor Details

    • CustomerWindowController

      public CustomerWindowController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize​(java.net.URL url, java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initializes the tableview when the scene is changed to this window. The tableview gets its data from the database using getter functions from the Fetcher class. Uses MasterList to hold Customer objects for the class.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - A URL.
      resourceBundle - A ResourceBundle.
      See Also:
      Fetcher, MasterList

    • addButtonClicked

      public void addButtonClicked() throws java.io.IOException
      Changes the scene to a new window where a user can enter data to create a new customer and save it to the database.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Throws IOException if there is an error loading the FXML file.

    • modifyButtonClicked

      public void modifyButtonClicked() throws java.lang.Exception
      Changes the scene to a new window where a user can modify existing Customer data and save it to the database.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is an error loading the FXML file or calling the populateFields() method.

    • deleteButtonClicked

      public void deleteButtonClicked() throws java.lang.Exception
      Deletes the selected Customer and displays an Alert Box with a confirmation that the Customer was deleted successfully. Then reloads the CustomerWindowUI FXML file.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is an error in EditDatabase or loading the FXML file.

    • backButtonClicked

      public void backButtonClicked() throws java.io.IOException
      The back button changes the scene back to the main window
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Throws IOException if there is an error loading the FXML file.

    • getSelectedCustomer

      public Customer getSelectedCustomer()
      Gets the selected Customer object from the customerTable.
      Returns:
      Returns the currently selected Customer object from the customerTable.
